column3: If God is not sending earthquakes, destroying economies and inflicting pain upon human beings, what is God doing? God works through people, calling them to help their neighbors in need. God comforts His people, walking with them even 'through the valley of the shadow of death.'

Death has its revelations: the great sorrows which open the heart open the mind as well; light comes to us with our grief. As for me, I have faith; I believe in a future life. How could I do otherwise? My daughter was a soul; I saw this soul. I touched it, so to speak.
You can't go wrong with major life and death stories when it comes to a competition, so I thought I'd have a go at writing one.
Life will end in death and unhappiness, but we do it anyway.
I wanted to acknowledge that life goes on but that death goes on, too. A person who is dead is a long, long story.

The Negro race, like all races, is going to be saved by its exceptional men. The problem of education, then, among Negroes must first of all deal with the Talented Tenth; it is the problem of developing the Best of this race that they may guide the Mass away from the contamination and death of the Worst, in their own and other races.
The common bees will never use their sting upon the queen; if she is to be disposed of, they starve her to death, and the queen herself will sting nothing but royalty, nothing but a rival queen.
We should weep for men at their birth, not at their death.
An insatiable appetite for glory leads to sacrifice and death, but innate instinct leads to self-preservation and life.

I really don't know where my interest in death comes from. Maybe I've just got a twisted imagination. The truth is, I haven't had a hugely eventful life - maybe I'm compensating in my creative life. Or maybe I'm just a bit sick.

Good is positive. Evil is merely privative, not absolute: it is like cold, which is the privation of heat. All evil is so much death or nonentity. Benevolence is absolute and real. So much benevolence as a man hath, so much life hath he.
Any man's death diminishes me, because I am involved in Mankind; And therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls; it tolls for thee.
Man, as long as he lives, is immortal. One minute before his death he shall be immortal. But one minute later, God wins.

The idea is to die young as late as possible.
Do not fear death so much but rather the inadequate life.
I decided to devote my life to telling the story because I felt that having survived I owe something to the dead. and anyone who does not remember betrays them again.
Our dead are never dead to us, until we have forgotten them.
While I thought that I was learning how to live, I have been learning how to die.
The words of a dead man are modified in the guts of the living.
I shall not die of a cold. I shall die of having lived.
Birth and death; we all move between these two unknowns.
The dead cannot cry out for justice. It is a duty of the living to do so for them.
If we must die, we die defending our rights.
